description: Complete GES JHS Curriculum (B7-B9 / JHS1-3) - NaCCA Common Core Programme
source: National Council for Curriculum and Assessment (NaCCA) - Ghana Education Service
note: This curriculum follows the Common Core Programme (CCP) standards-based approach focusing on 4Rs (Reading, wRiting, aRithmetic, cReativity) and core competencies

subjects.description: Mathematics forms an integral part of everyday life. This curriculum emphasizes practical application, problem-solving, and mathematical literacy for sustainable development.

strands.description: Develops number sense, operations, and applications in real-world contexts

b7_topics: Rounding to decimal places and significant figures
b9_topics: Very large and very small numbers
Squares, square roots, cubes and cube roots

b7_topics: Multiplication and division by powers of 10
Addition and subtraction of multi-digit numbers
Multiplication of multi-digit numbers by 1 and 2-digit numbers
Solving problems with HCF and LCM
b8_topics: Division law of indices (aᵐ ÷ aⁿ = aᵐ⁻ⁿ)
b9_topics: Applications of indices in science and technology

b7_topics: Benchmark fractions (halves, thirds, quarters, fifths, tenths)
Converting between fractions, decimals, and percentages
Adding and subtracting fractions with different denominators
b8_topics: Expressing one quantity as a percentage of another
Ratios in maps and scale drawings

strands.description: Develops algebraic thinking, pattern recognition, and problem-solving using symbols

b8_topics: Finding the nth term of linear sequences

b7_topics: Simplifying expressions by collecting like terms
Index notation in algebra (a², a³, etc.)
Equations with unknowns on both sides
Changing the subject of simple formulas
b9_topics: Completing the square to solve equations

strands.description: Develops spatial reasoning, measurement skills, and geometric understanding

b7_topics: Properties of quadrilaterals (square, rectangle, parallelogram, rhombus, trapezium, kite)
Angles: acute, obtuse, right, reflex, straight
Angles in parallel lines (corresponding, alternate, co-interior)
Constructing triangles with ruler and compass
Parts of a circle (radius, diameter, chord, arc, sector, segment)
3D shapes (cube, cuboid, cylinder, cone, sphere, pyramid, prism)
b8_topics: Conditions for congruence (SSS, SAS, ASA, RHS)
b9_topics: Circle theorems (angle in a semicircle, angles at center and circumference)

b7_topics: Units of length (mm, cm, m, km)
b8_topics: Area of composite shapes including circles
Surface area of cubes and cuboids
b9_topics: Volume and surface area of composite solids
Units: conversion between metric and imperial
Graphs of linear functions (y = mx + c)

strands.description: Develops data literacy, statistical thinking, and probability reasoning

b9_topics: Using line of best fit for predictions

b7_topics: Probability language (impossible, unlikely, even chance, likely, certain)
b8_topics: Addition rule for mutually exclusive events
Using tree diagrams to calculate probabilities

subjects.description: Science curriculum develops curiosity, scientific inquiry skills, and understanding of the natural world to prepare learners for technological advancement.

strands.description: Understanding materials, living cells, and their properties

b7_topics: Properties of solids, liquids, and gases
Changes of state (melting, freezing, boiling, condensing, sublimation)
Uses of common materials in Ghana
Cell as basic unit of life
Differences between plant and animal cells
Cell parts and their functions (nucleus, cytoplasm, cell membrane, cell wall, chloroplast, vacuole)
Five kingdoms (Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae, Animalia)
b8_topics: Growth and development in living things

strands.description: Understanding natural cycles and life processes

b7_topics: Elements of weather (temperature, rainfall, wind, humidity, sunshine)
b8_topics: Structure of the Earth (crust, mantle, outer core, inner core)

b7_topics: Parts of a flower and functions
b8_topics: Growth stages in humans (infancy, childhood, adolescence, adulthood)

b7_topics: Types of crops (cereals, legumes, root and tubers, vegetables, fruits)
Livestock animals in Ghana (cattle, sheep, goats, pigs, rabbits)
b8_topics: Soil types in Ghana (sandy, clay, loam)
b9_topics: Cash crops in Ghana (cocoa, coffee, oil palm, rubber)

strands.description: Understanding human body systems and ecosystems

b7_topics: Nutrients (carbohydrates, proteins, fats, vitamins, minerals, water)
Food tests (starch, reducing sugars, protein, fats)
Blood components (plasma, red cells, white cells, platelets)
b9_topics: Central nervous system (brain and spinal cord)
Sense organs (eye, ear, nose, tongue, skin)
Major glands (pituitary, thyroid, pancreas, adrenal, gonads)

strands.description: Understanding energy forms, forces, motion, and electricity

b7_topics: Forms of energy (kinetic, potential, heat, light, sound, electrical, chemical, nuclear)
Energy sources (fossil fuels, solar, wind, hydro, biomass)
Advantages and disadvantages of energy sources

b8_topics: Relationship between voltage, current, and resistance

b7_topics: Effects of force (motion, shape change, direction change)
Types of forces (gravity, friction, magnetic, tension, upthrust)

strands.description: Understanding environmental health and sustainable practices

b7_topics: Sources of waste at home and school

b8_topics: First aid for cuts and wounds
